reviewText: I received this product in a week with the wrapper in great condition and no scratches, scuffs, or marks of any kind. My husband is very happy with this series and the information it contains and the price was not bad. My husband is a History Channel fanatic and loves this set.

reviewText: I was disappointed with this set, from the description of so much content and being History channel I expected it to be great, but unfortunately many of the shows just repeat the same stories and content over and over, and the shows themselves repeat the same thing over and over, like watching one of those 2 hour news magazine story's where they stretch 15 mins of content into 2 hours. There is very little real footage either, mostly dramatic reenactments of sightings. There are much better substantive sets out there I would recommend over this set,http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003480096/ for instance is head and shoulders over this set at a fraction of the price.
Title: N/A

reviewText: As recently as 2007, I used to laugh inwardly whenever I heard people profess belief in UFOs.  But after hearing about a mass UFO sighting in January 2008 in the town where I went to college, I became curious and couldn't stop researching the topic.  The History Channel seriesUFO Hunterswas certainly informative, but much more convincing were a few of the episodes from its predecessor, "UFO Files."  This DVD set contains eight of the "UFO Files" episodes that were originally broadcast on The History Channel from 2005 to 2007.Before watching these episodes, I had never heard of the phenomenon of Unidentified Submerged Objects (USOs).  USOs are UFOs that dive down below our oceans and are able to remain and operate successfully there.  One episode talks about incidences of USOs near California, Russia, Australia, Canada, and Puerto Rico, and recounts 911 calls from 1992 from observers on the California coast that saw USOs silently rise up out of the Pacific and fly off.A related episode discusses the "Dragon's Triangle" off the coast of Japan.  In that region over the centuries, numerous planes and ships have disappeared; ships have lost their compass readings, have suffered sudden shifts in the space-time continuum, and recorded missing time; unmanned 'ghost' ships with the entire crew missing have been reported; and there have been numerous sightings of UFOs/USOs diving into and rising up out of the ocean.  I found this much more convincing than conventional UFO sightings; if it is one thing to be skeptical about stories of strange objects in the sky, it is much more difficult to disbelieve sightings of objects submerging into and emerging from bodies of water.The other big argument that changed my mind involved the sighting of objects in the sky in the times well before human flight.  This DVD set suggests that one of the biggest figures in world history saw a UFO in the fifteenth century and that people in Japan saw objects in the sky more than two centuries before that.  Not included in this set was the story of something even more difficult to discount--the 1561 Nuremberg sighting of an aerial battle, an event that was even documented in an early form of newspaper at the time and that took place centuries before the advent of balloons, let alone airplanes.One of the best episodes on this set recalls black box reports from pilots.  Pilots, who know aircraft as well as anyone, in the course of their flights describe aircraft that they are not familiar with, that are vastly larger than any manmade aircraft, are noiseless, and make what would seem to us impossible moves at impossible speeds.  The episode also notes that astronauts have also seen unconventional objects while in space.Another especially enjoyable episode discusses UFOs and the presidency from FDR to George W. Bush and claims that four presidents (two from each party) have seen UFOs--an assertion that belies the notion that belief in UFOs is the sole province of addled ex-hippies and Star Trek geeks.The episodes in this set also examine implanted metal objects in those unfortunate enough to be contacted by UFOs, government secrecy and coverups as far as what was recovered from UFO crashes, and interviews with elderly people who before their deaths told what they heard concerning UFOs while working on military bases in the mid-twentieth century.  Anyone with the slightest interest in UFOs would find this set entertaining and informative.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I think UFO Files is a very good show, and over the years the show did a lot of very interesting investigations into UFO cases not well known from the general public. So as a fan of the show I bought this DVD Set....and I am very disappointed by it. First of all this set features only 8 episodes; out of the 40+ episodes of UFO Files it's not a lot. Why only 8 episodes !!?? Why not at least 10 !? Very bad decision by The History Channel. Also: Out of the 8 episodes 4 of them are already on the "History Classic: UFOs and Aliens" DVD Set. "Deep Sea UFO: Red Alert", "UFOs of the 70's", "UFOs and the White House" and "Hangar 18" are all on that other DVD Set. And this is not a "Best of", a lot of episodes were way better than the 8 who are featured on this set. Where is the episode about Shag Harbour ?? The episode about "China's Roswell", the show about Area 51 or the one about The UFO crash in Mexico ?? I don't know who decided the episodes that would make the cut on this set but he or she did a terrible job.The History Channel should release all 40+ episodes on DVD. Why they don't want to do it is beyond me. Anyway buy this set only if it's under 20$. Disappointing for the real fans of the show.
summary: Should have been a lot better....

reviewText: The History Channel UFO Files series features well-made programs that have witness statements, actual tape recordings of UFO encounters, written records, interesting simulations, and archive films.  Impressive cases are the following: (1) On November 17, 1986, Japan Airlines Flight 1628, a Boeing 747 cargo jet, that while cruising at 600 miles per hour at 35,000 feet to Alaska was followed for 400 miles by a large UFO and two smaller UFOs, an experience that was also followed on military radar.  (2) On October 2, 1962, off the Sardinia coast, USS Franklin D. Roosevelt radar operator Harry Jordan's tracking of a UFO that traveled at 4,000 miles per hour that made right angle turns that were more like Z patterns four times and had no heat signature when stopped.  (3) On March 1963, 100 miles from Puerto Rico, a U.S. Navy submarine exercise tracks a USO at a depth of 20,000 feet moving in excess of 150 knots for almost four days.  I appreciated the professional presentation of these programs.
Title: N/A
